page.description: Properties and methods in the Arguments Class.

property.name: Arguments
property.description: Type "P". Mode "R". An array of SQL::Argument objects.

property.name: Count
property.description: Type "N". Mode "R". The number of arguments.

methodref.name: Add
methodref.description: Add an argument to the collection. or L Add(SQL::Argument Argument)

methodref.name: Find
methodref.description: Find an argument in the collection.

methodref.name: Remove
methodref.description: Remove an argument from the collection.

methodref.name: Set
methodref.description: Set the value and (optionally) the usage of an argument.

methodref.name: ArgumentNumber
methodref.description: Get the sequence number of the named argument. Returns -1 if not found.

methodref.name: SetNull
methodref.description: Set a value to NULL and (optionally) the usage of an argument.

section.title: Example
section.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection dim sql as C dim vCity as C dim args as SQL::Arguments vCity = ui_get_text("City", "Show Companies in what city?") sql = "select lastname, firstname from customer where bill_city = :city Order By Company" if .not. conn.open("{A5API=Access,FileName='C:\Program Files\a5v8\MDBFiles\Alphasports.mdb', UserName='Admin'}") ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) end end if if .not. args.Set("city", vCity) end end if if .not. conn.execute(sql, args) ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) end end if sql_resultset_preview(conn.resultset)

page.limitations: Desktop applications only prior to Version 9.
